original_title: Palabras para un fin del mundo
overview: Spain, 1931. The Second Republic is born. The writer and philosopher Miguel de Unamuno is considered one of the ethical pillars of the new regime. Five years later, on December 31, 1936, a few months after the beginning of the Spanish Civil War, Unamuno dies in his home in Salamanca, the propaganda center of the rebel side, led by General Francisco Franco.
title: Palabras para un fin del mundo
